availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John R. Barnes (Hardin County, Kentucky, resident and soldier in the 37th KY)

body.p: Hardin County, Kentucky, resident and soldier. Kentucky native. Son or Dorsey Barnes and Anne Barnes. Resident in Hardin County, Kentucky, in 1850. Resident in Hardin County in 1860. Served in Company D 37th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry (U.S.A.) as a Private from October 24, 1863, to December 29, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, Southern District, p. 444A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, District 2, p. 291.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, Elizabethtown p. 291A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 417.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 373.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Application #932755, Certificate #702193.
"John Riley Barnes (1846-1909)," Find A Grave, Memorial #32911823, accessed January 12, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/32911823.
